meanings.definition: The act of joining incorrectly or inappropriately.
meanings.sent1: The misunion of the puzzle pieces made it impossible to complete the picture.
meanings.sent2: The misunion of the train tracks caused a derailment.
meanings.sent3: The misunion of the mismatched socks led to a fashion disaster.
meanings.sent4: The misunion of the orchestra's instruments created a cacophony of sounds.
meanings.sent5: The misunion of the ingredients resulted in a failed recipe.

meanings.definition: A lack of unity or harmony.
meanings.sent1: The misunion between the team members affected their performance.
meanings.sent2: The misunion in the choir's voices was evident during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The misunion of colors in the painting gave it a unique charm.
meanings.sent4: The misunion of opinions led to a heated debate.
meanings.sent5: The misunion of the elements created a chaotic scene.
